intro: Tulipa violacea var. pallida, commonly known as the pale violet tulip, is a cultivar of the tulip species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its pale violet to almost white petals, which give it a delicate and elegant appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–20 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It blooms in early spring, producing showy, cup-shaped flowers that are highly valued in gardens for their beauty. This variety is well-suited for rock gardens and borders, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun.
